meanings.definition: Transfer or delegate (power or responsibility) to a lower level, especially from central government to local or regional administration.
meanings.sent1: The mayor devolves some of his duties to the city council to help manage the town.
meanings.sent2: It is common for national governments to devolve certain powers to state governments.
meanings.sent3: The superhero devolves his crime-fighting responsibilities to his trusty sidekick.
meanings.sent4: As the CEO retired, he devolved his leadership role to his capable successor.
meanings.sent5: The teacher devolves the task of leading the class discussion to a student each week.

meanings.definition: Pass on (property or rights) to a successor.
meanings.sent1: Before his passing, the grandfather devolves his antique watch to his grandson.
meanings.sent2: In his will, he devolves his vast estate to his only daughter.
meanings.sent3: The pirate captain jokingly devolves his treasure map to the parrot.
meanings.sent4: The retiring professor devolves his research projects to his eager young colleague.
meanings.sent5: The retiring king devolves his crown to his eldest son, the prince.

meanings.sent1: Over time, the old building devolves into a state of disrepair.
meanings.sent2: If left unattended, the garden will slowly devolve into a wild tangle of weeds.
meanings.sent3: The once grand mansion devolves into a haunted house in the spooky Halloween story.
meanings.sent4: Without proper maintenance, the machinery will devolve into a useless pile of metal.
meanings.sent5: Neglecting regular exercise can cause your health to devolve over time.
